  • Attraktives Gesamtpaket: Profitiere von 30 Tagen Urlaub, einem Remote-First-Ansatz, modernster Hardware und einem wettbewerbsfähigen Gehalt

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Description:
The Company

Payrails is an innovative technology company with a team that has many years of experience in the payment industry and a real-life understanding of the merchants’ needs. We have seen the complexity firsthand and we have learned from all the challenges we've faced. Now we want to help leading technology companies around the world accept payments and build financial services with minimal upfront investments.

Our vision at Payrails is to reimagine payments. We do this by removing heavy reliance on Engineering efforts using composable building blocks that put the control firmly in the hands of our customers. We exist to help our customers become more productive and flexible, impacting directly on their ability to grow.

We are joined in our mission by top-tier investors Andreessen Horowitz, HV Capital, EQT and General Catalyst alongside a great cast of knowledgeable angel investors to enable us to solve the growing complexity of payments.

At Payrails, we are committed to building a team full of the most talented people. Excellence is part of our values and we understand that in order to achieve this, we need to build an environment where skilled people can work openly, collaboratively, and with the utmost trust in one another. We believe people thrive the most when they are fully aware of what the business is trying to achieve, why it is important to the market, and what challenges lie in the way to reaching our goals. In such an environment we believe people can truly excel, grow and enjoy working together. We try hard to be a company where everyone is inspired and feels a sense of responsibility to do the right thing to help us bring our vision to life. Succeeding with us is about finding solutions to the most pressing problems and executing them effectively.

Your Team

At Payrails, our Data team empowers all teams to uncover insights and transform them into actions that enhance the value and impact of our products and solutions. We champion data-enabled decision-making and recognize the importance of using the data as a tool to make optimal decisions.

What You Will Be Doing


You will develop and optimize reports, perform ad-hoc and deep-dive analyses to facilitate data-driven decision making.
You will improve and maintain our reporting data models, enabling self-service analytics across the company..
You will gain insights from the data and utilize them to enhance internal functions performance.
You will work in a highly effective team focusing on increasing the value and impact of our products.


You'll be great for this role if


You have more than 7 years of professional experience in Analytics, Business Intelligence or other related fields.
You have strong SQL skills, and have worked with GoodData, Tableau, Looker, or other Business Intelligence tools.
You have a solid knowledge of statistical techniques: distributions, statistical testing, regression, multivariate testing, etc.
You have experience in data analysis and can handle confidently large datasets
You have a good understanding of data modeling.
You are fluent in English and have excellent communication skills (both with technical and business teams).
Strong analytical and natural curiosity with a desire to explore new ideas, concepts, and ways to improve.
Proactive approach, taking initiative to anticipate needs and drive results independently.


Why You should join Payrails


You can truly create your own path by taking responsibility and implementing your own ideas
We offer visa and relocation support to you and your family where required
We offer a hybrid working environment
You have 27 annual vacation days + 1 day of paid birthday leave for you to have fun and party without any worries!
We get together regularly for team lunches and events
You help us shape the future of payments


At Payrails, we prioritize a culture of inclusivity and diversity, evaluating candidates solely based on their skills and potential, regardless of age, gender, identity, ethnicity, sexual orientation, disability status, or religion. We welcome applications from individuals of all backgrounds and identities. In line with our commitment to fairness, we kindly request applicants to refrain from including personal details such as a picture, age, or marital status in their CVs.

Title: Senior Marketing Data Analyst
Description:
At Entyre, our mission is to reduce both under and over-provision of healthcare through the intelligent combination of human expertise and technology. Our dedicated care consultants work tirelessly on an international level, supported by our proprietary software solutions.

We believe that individuals in need of care, who are looked after by their relatives at home, have the right to live a self-determined and dignified life in their own homes. With our brands Pflegewegweiser and Entyre Care, we are committed to achieving this goal by focusing on two central pillars: providing professional support to caregiving relatives in all areas of home care with our extensive expertise and ensuring fair monetary compensation for their efforts. We are also driving the development of innovative solutions in collaboration with scientific partners.

In this vital, dynamic, and international environment, we are looking for a Senior Marketing Data Analyst (m/f/d) to join our team in Berlin.




Role

We are seeking a detail-oriented and data-driven Marketing Data Analyst to join our dynamic Marketing Team. You will work closely with cross-functional teams, including marketing, sales, and operations, to interpret data and help shape marketing strategies that drive our mission forward. Reporting to the Chief Marketing Officer, this Massachusetts-based role will support our efforts to reach underserved communities and enhance our service offerings.




Key Responsibilities

Develop data models with DBT on DataBricks for marketing, sales and operations
Develop optimized SQL queries to aggregate and explore data from multiple datasets, identify opportunities and limitations within our data sets and deliver reliable and high quality analysis to drive strategic insights.
Translate complex data insights into compelling narratives that drive action across marketing and leadership teams.
Enable teams with self-service analytics by maintaining curated data sources and developing automated, scalable dashboards by applying intuitive data visualization and dashboard design best practices.
Own key projects and respond to ad-hoc data requests from internal and external stakeholders. Define, calculate, and validate key performance metrics (KPIs), identifying automation opportunities and developing self-service analytics solutions.
Communicate with stakeholders on various projects to gather requirements, collect feedback and present deliverables to achieve expected outcomes.
Brainstorm creative solutions to exploratory projects built around ambiguity, including running analysis to identify problems, understand root cause of trends, provide actionable insights and recommend solutions.
Work collaboratively and cross functionally with other members of the data team to support testing/experimentation, data modeling, data visualization & data science.
Collaborate with data scientists to leverage A/B testing and incrementality analysis to measure marketing effectiveness and optimize campaign performance.




Value Proposition

Make a Life-Changing Impact: Your analyses will directly contribute to improving the lives of millions. You will play a crucial role in helping low-income families access quality homecare.
Personal Growth and Learning Opportunities: Join a vibrant, dedicated team and contribute to building the next industry-defining company. You’ll gain exposure to various aspects of the business while expanding your skills.
Energizing & Flat Hierarchy Team Culture: We care deeply about one another and are committed to collaboration and teamwork. You’ll have the autonomy to drive your initiatives and make a meaningful impact.




Hard Requirements

Minimum of 4 years of experience in growth marketing analytics, data science, preferably in direct-to-consumer and e-commerce companies.
Experience with marketing analytics, attribution modelling, customer segmentation, and predictive modelling for growth and retention.
Expertise in SQL and proficiency in either Python (or R) for advanced data analysis and automation. Experience with dbt, Looker, or other modern analytics tools is a plus.
Familiarity with B2C acquisition and subscription marketing concepts and metrics, including customer journeys, conversion funnels and critical reporting (CAC, payback, retention rate, etc.).
Hands-on experience working with structured and unstructured data in cloud-based environments, like Databricks, BigQuery etc.
Comfortable navigating large datasets, acquiring and cleansing data from multiple sources.
Demonstrates intellectual curiosity, a self-motivated approach to problem-solving, and a passion for continuous learning and improvement.
Advanced analytical skills with the ability to be a self starter and work independently.
Advanced data visualization skills
Familiarity with marketing, CRM, social and ad platforms, such as HubSpot, Google Ads, Facebook, YouTube, Instagram, TikTok and others. Experience with partnership and affiliate marketing is a plus.
Exceptional communication and stakeholder management skills, with the ability to translate technical concepts into business-friendly insights.
Ability to collaborate with partners to document key business needs into a clearly defined requirements document and project plan.
Proven skills in distilling complex topics into easy to understand data visualizations. Advanced Tableau data visualization skills preferred.







Soft Requirements

Passionate and Impact-Driven: You thrive in fast-paced environments and are eager to contribute to transformational change in the healthcare industry.
Strategic Thinker: You have strong strategic thinking abilities combined with a hands-on execution mindset. You understand the importance of data in driving marketing initiatives.
Detail-Oriented: Exceptional attention to detail, ensuring accuracy and thoroughness in data analysis and reporting.
Open-Minded and Team Player: You enjoy collaborating with others and have a willingness to learn and adapt. You view challenges as opportunities for growth and innovation.




Ready to make an impact? Apply now and join us in redefining homecare!

Title: Data Analyst (d/f/m) in Customer Service
Description:
mobile.de is Germany's largest vehicle marketplace with about 1.4 million listed cars, trucks, and motorcycles. Both private customers and more than 40,000 registered vehicle dealers use the platform. Including listing exports to the sister platform Kleinanzeigen, mobile.de reaches about 20 million unique users per month (AGMA digital facts; mobile.de and Kleinanzeigen; categories: cars, motorcycles, commercial vehicles, motorhomes; Ø month April 2022 to March 2023). As a "one-stop shop," mobile.de offers not only buying and selling services but also financing and leasing solutions, among others. The company, founded in 1996, is a subsidiary of Adevinta, a globally leading provider of online classifieds portals.

mobile.de is part of Adevinta: a global online classifieds specialist and sustainability leader with 25+ products in 10 countries.

What You’ll Do & Who You Are

Join Us: Shape the Future of Customer Experience with Data! Be Our Data Hero!

Are you driven by the power of data to transform customer experiences? Do you crave a role where your insights directly fuel our success? We're looking for a passionate CS Data Analyst to join our team in Berlin and help us redefine customer service.

Join our dynamic Customer Service team at mobile.de. You'll be an important player amongst 16 internal colleagues and collaborate with 100+ external partners, reporting to our Manager of External Customer Service.

What You'll Achieve With Us


Unlock Customer Secrets: Dive deep into user behavior and reveal the hidden patterns that drive satisfaction.
Fuel Our Growth: Turn your data discoveries into actionable strategies that optimize our operations and elevate customer happiness.
Innovate & Inspire: Collaborate with our team to build cutting-edge dashboards and reporting tools that empower data-driven decisions.
Make a Real Impact: Directly influence our KPIs and see your recommendations translate into tangible improvements.
Be a Key Player: Partner with stakeholders across the company to ensure data accuracy and consistency, becoming a trusted advisor.


You'll Thrive Here If You


Are excited to contribute to a team that values data-driven innovation.
Have 3+ years of experience in an analyst role, and are ready to bring your skills to a dynamic customer service environment.
Possess a strong command of business intelligence tools (Tableau, Looker, etc.) and data querying languages (SQL, Python, R).
Understand the critical importance of customer service metrics (CSAT, NPS, etc.) and how they impact our success.
Are fluent in English and have good German skills, enabling seamless collaboration with our diverse team.
Hold a Bachelor's degree in Data Science, Statistics, or a related field, and are eager to apply your knowledge in a real-world setting.
Are ready to translate complex data into clear, actionable strategies that propel our team forward.


Why Join Us? We're not just looking for an analyst – we're looking for someone to join our mission. You'll be part of a team that's passionate about delivering exceptional customer experiences, and you'll have the opportunity to make a real difference. If you're ready to use your data skills to shape the future of customer service, we want to hear from you!

Benefits

Life at Adevinta comes with its perks! Our Adevintans enjoy the following benefits:


An attractive Base Salary 💸
Participation in our Short Term Incentive plan (annual bonus) 🏆
Work From Anywhere: Enjoy up to 20 days a year of working from anywhere! Maybe not from the moon🌛well why not! just make sure you have internet connection! 🌍
A 24/7 Employee Assistance Program for you and your family, because we care ❤️
Win together, lose together is one of our key behaviours. At Adevinta you will find a collaborative environment with an opportunity to explore your potential and grow 🌱


On top of these, we also provide a range of locally relevant benefits. Wanna know more? Apply and ask our recruiters! ✨

Adevinta is an equal opportunity employer and we value diversity. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, colour, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status or disability status.

If you feel like you don’t meet all of the requirements for this role but are interested, please consider applying anyway. Research suggests that women and individuals from underrepresented groups may self-select out of opportunities if they don’t meet 100% of the job requirements. We strongly encourage people from historically excluded groups to apply and look forward to speaking with you.
Show more
HTML:
mobile.de is Germany's largest vehicle marketplace with about 1.4 million listed cars, trucks, and motorcycles. Both private customers and more than 40,000 registered vehicle dealers use the platform. Including listing exports to the sister platform Kleinanzeigen, mobile.de reaches about 20 million unique users per month (AGMA digital facts; mobile.de and Kleinanzeigen; categories: cars, motorcycles, commercial vehicles, motorhomes; Ø month April 2022 to March 2023). As a "one-stop shop," mobile.de offers not only buying and selling services but also financing and leasing solutions, among others. The company, founded in 1996, is a subsidiary of Adevinta, a globally leading provider of online classifieds portals.

mobile.de is part of Adevinta: a global online classifieds specialist and sustainability leader with 25+ products in 10 countries.

What You’ll Do & Who You Are

Join Us: Shape the Future of Customer Experience with Data! Be Our Data Hero!

Are you driven by the power of data to transform customer experiences? Do you crave a role where your insights directly fuel our success? We're looking for a passionate CS Data Analyst to join our team in Berlin and help us redefine customer service.

Join our dynamic Customer Service team at mobile.de. You'll be an important player amongst 16 internal colleagues and collaborate with 100+ external partners, reporting to our Manager of External Customer Service.

What You'll Achieve With Us

  • Unlock Customer Secrets: Dive deep into user behavior and reveal the hidden patterns that drive satisfaction.
  • Fuel Our Growth: Turn your data discoveries into actionable strategies that optimize our operations and elevate customer happiness.
  • Innovate & Inspire: Collaborate with our team to build cutting-edge dashboards and reporting tools that empower data-driven decisions.
  • Make a Real Impact: Directly influence our KPIs and see your recommendations translate into tangible improvements.
  • Be a Key Player: Partner with stakeholders across the company to ensure data accuracy and consistency, becoming a trusted advisor.

You'll Thrive Here If You

  • Are excited to contribute to a team that values data-driven innovation.
  • Have 3+ years of experience in an analyst role, and are ready to bring your skills to a dynamic customer service environment.
  • Possess a strong command of business intelligence tools (Tableau, Looker, etc.) and data querying languages (SQL, Python, R).
  • Understand the critical importance of customer service metrics (CSAT, NPS, etc.) and how they impact our success.
  • Are fluent in English and have good German skills, enabling seamless collaboration with our diverse team.
  • Hold a Bachelor's degree in Data Science, Statistics, or a related field, and are eager to apply your knowledge in a real-world setting.
  • Are ready to translate complex data into clear, actionable strategies that propel our team forward.

Why Join Us? We're not just looking for an analyst – we're looking for someone to join our mission. You'll be part of a team that's passionate about delivering exceptional customer experiences, and you'll have the opportunity to make a real difference. If you're ready to use your data skills to shape the future of customer service, we want to hear from you!

Benefits

Life at Adevinta comes with its perks! Our Adevintans enjoy the following benefits:

  • An attractive Base Salary 💸
  • Participation in our Short Term Incentive plan (annual bonus) 🏆
  • Work From Anywhere: Enjoy up to 20 days a year of working from anywhere! Maybe not from the moon🌛well why not! just make sure you have internet connection! 🌍
  • A 24/7 Employee Assistance Program for you and your family, because we care ❤️
  • Win together, lose together is one of our key behaviours. At Adevinta you will find a collaborative environment with an opportunity to explore your potential and grow 🌱

On top of these, we also provide a range of locally relevant benefits. Wanna know more? Apply and ask our recruiters! ✨

Adevinta is an equal opportunity employer and we value diversity. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, colour, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status or disability status.

If you feel like you don’t meet all of the requirements for this role but are interested, please consider applying anyway. Research suggests that women and individuals from underrepresented groups may self-select out of opportunities if they don’t meet 100% of the job requirements. We strongly encourage people from historically excluded groups to apply and look forward to speaking with you.

Title: Data Analyst (m/w/d)
Description:
Werde Teil eines innovativen Teams bei Education Partners als “Data Analyst” (m/w/d)




Bist du begeistert von der Macht der Daten und möchtest entscheidende Einblicke liefern, die den Unternehmenserfolg vorantreiben? Education Partners, ein führendes Unternehmen im Bereich der transformativen Bildung, gestaltet das Lernen und Wachsen neu. Mit aktuell 12 hochmodernen Akademien in ganz Europa treiben wir Innovationen in der digitalen Bildung voran.




Was wir bieten:

Hybrides Arbeitsmodell: Genieße die Flexibilität, sowohl von zu Hause als auch in unserem modernen Büro im Herzen Berlins zu arbeiten.
Modernste Technologie-Umgebung: Nutze die neuesten Datenanalyse-Tools und Business Intelligence-Lösungen in einem dynamischen Umfeld.
Wirkungsvolle Arbeit: Deine Analysen und Insights beeinflussen direkt die strategischen Entscheidungen.
Berufliche Weiterentwicklung: Wir fördern kontinuierliches Lernen durch Zugang zu Workshops, Konferenzen und erstklassigen Weiterbildungsangeboten.
Attraktives Gesamtpaket: Profitiere von 30 Tagen Urlaub, einem Remote-First-Ansatz, modernster Hardware und einem wettbewerbsfähigen Gehalt.




Dein Impact:

Datenanalyse & Insights: Du analysierst große und komplexe Datensätze, um wertvolle Insights zu gewinnen, die unser Verständnis von Kundenverhalten, Markttrends und Geschäftsentwicklungen vertiefen.
Dashboard- & Reporting-Erstellung: Du entwickelst aussagekräftige Dashboards und Berichte, um datenbasierte Entscheidungen zu erleichtern – idealerweise mit Power BI oder vergleichbaren Tools.
Datengetriebene Prozessoptimierung: Du identifizierst Potenziale zur Verbesserung interner Prozesse und unterstützt die Fachbereiche dabei, datenbasierte Strategien umzusetzen.
Zusammenarbeit mit Fachabteilungen: Du arbeitest eng mit Teams aus Marketing, Produkt und Business Development zusammen, um operative sowie strategische Maßnahmen zu steuern.
Tracking & Datenqualität: Du stellst sicher, dass relevante Daten zuverlässig erfasst werden. Dafür unterstützt du bei der Implementierung von Tracking- und Analyse-Tools wie Google Analytics und Google Tag Manager.
Automatisierung & Skalierung: Du optimierst Datenprozesse, entwickelst Automatisierungen und sorgst für eine effiziente Nutzung der verfügbaren Datenquellen.




Was wir suchen:

Analytische Denkweise & datengetriebenes Mindset: Du hast ein ausgeprägtes Gespür für Daten, erfasst komplexe Zusammenhänge schnell und übersetzt diese in präzise Handlungsempfehlungen.
Tools: Du bist sicher im Umgang mit SQL und Excel/Google Sheets und kannst große Datensätze effizient analysieren und verarbeiten.
Erfahrung mit Datenvisualisierung: Du kennst Dich mit Tools wie Power BI, Tableau oder Looker aus und erstellst Dashboards und Berichte, die wichtige KPIs verständlich darstellen (Power BI bevorzugt).
Kenntnisse in Tracking & Web Analytics: Idealerweise hast Du Erfahrung mit Google Analytics und Google Tag Manager (GTM) und weißt, wie man Nutzerverhalten richtig auswertet.
Teamplayer & Kommunikationsstärke: Du arbeitest gerne mit verschiedenen Fachabteilungen zusammen und kannst komplexe Daten verständlich präsentieren – auch für Nicht-Analysten.
Startup-Mentalität & Eigeninitiative: Du fühlst dich in dynamischen Umfeldern wohl, übernimmst Verantwortung und treibst datengetriebene Projekte eigenständig voran.
Sprachkenntnisse: Fließende Deutschkenntnisse in Wort und Schrift sind für diese Rolle erforderlich.

Nice-to-Have:

Erfahrung im Marketing oder Performance Marketing und ein Verständnis für datengetriebene Marketingstrategien.
Erfahrung mit Automatisierung und Skalierung von Datenprozessen.
Kenntnisse in der Anwendung von Machine Learning oder Predictive Analytics sind ein Plus.




Werde Teil unseres Teams und hilf dabei, die Zukunft des Lernens zu gestalten, indem du fundierte datengetriebene Entscheidungen ermöglicht, die unsere Geschäftsstrategie maßgeblich beeinflussen.

Title: Business Intelligence Consultant
Description:
Wir suchen Dich als Business Intelligence Consultant




InfoFabrik ist ein dynamisches und wachsendes mittelständisches Unternehmen mit einem zentralen Office in Berlin. Wir suchen nach einem erfahrenen und engagierten Business Intelligence Consultant (m/w/d), der unser Team unterstützt und maßgeschneiderte BI-Lösungen entwickelt, die unseren Kunden helfen, fundierte Entscheidungen zu treffen und ihre Geschäftsprozesse zu optimieren.




Was wir uns von dir wünschen:

mindestens 2 Jahre Erfahrung im Bereich BI & Data
Erfolgreiches Informatikstudium oder eine vergleichbare Qualifikation/Ausbildung
Sicherer Umgang mit SQL und Erweiterungen (PL/SQL, T-SQL oder vergleichbar)
Erfahrung im Datawarehousing
Business Analyse & Beratung von externen Kunden
Anforderungsanalyse, Spezifikation und Umsetzung
Stetige Optimierung der Entwicklungsprozesse
Konzeption von Testkonzepten und Implementierung der jeweiligen Testumgebung sowie Durchführung von Tests
Ausgeprägte Kunden- und Ergebnisorientierung
Strukturierte Arbeitsweise / analytisches Denken
Sehr gute Deutsch- und Englischkenntnisse




Wir haben tolle Aufgaben für dich:

Mitarbeit in verschiedenen parallelen Projekten mit viel Abwechslung im Arbeitsalltag
fachliche und persönliche Weiterentwicklung mit kompetenten Kollegen und anspruchsvollen Aufgaben
kleine Teams und übersichtliche Projekte




Techstack:

ReportServer (eigene Software für BI Lösungen)
Oracle Datenbank, PL/SQL
SQL-Server, T/SQL




Unsere Benefits:

mobiles Arbeiten ist möglich (2x pro Woche im Office)
Deutschlandticket
Betriebliche Altersvorsorge
Teamevents




Was uns ausmacht:

eine offene, wertschätzende und respektvolle Kommunikation auf Augenhöhe
starker Teamzusammenhalt dank flacher Hierarchien und schneller Entscheidungen




Haben wir Dein Interesse geweckt und Du hast Lust ein Teil unseres Teams zu werden, dann sende uns Deine Bewerbung an personal@InfoFabrik.de

Title: Data Analyst (m/f/d) in IT security company
Description:
Zertificon builds email encryption software that businesses trust and love to use. Our software protects millions of emails every day across businesses and industries that are part of your personal life too, like healthcare, retail, banking, and government. So, it's pretty likely that our products are already doing their bit to keep your personal information safe. With 20 years of expertise in cryptography, Zertificon is a recognized name in IT security. We’re proud to be independent and owner-operated, with a diverse team of 100 people from 20 nationalities, all working together to make digital business communication safer.




We believe in what we do. Every day our products make this world a safer place. With that our work has a Meaning, and this is very important to us. Freedom of communication is our core value, and that is the reason that we donate to Edward Snowden charity organization each time when an applicant mentions his name in the application and then is hired and passes the probation period by us.

We are burning for making the world a safer place. This needs security that actually works and is not bypassed for convenience. The key is automation and usability where people need to get involved. So we deliver this cyber security that is not limited to specialists and big companies. For security that cannot be easily compromized, not even by governments. Our products are scalable internationally and are truly user-friendly. We want to make cyber security available to everyone. And ease of use is the key, otherwise it won't be used.




Do you feel addressed? We are looking forward to hearing from you. And yeah, if you mention "I value what you value" within your application, we will know, what you mean:)




Data Analyst (m/f/d) in IT security company




What you would do:




Experience with Docker and Git is essential for this role. We are seeking a candidate who is comfortable working in Docker environments, skilled in version control systems, and possesses strong Python programming abilities beyond basic libraries like Pandas.




You'll collaborate directly with our Senior Data Scientist, helping turn raw data into insights and targets that drive our business goals.




Ensure data integrity, process, clean, and verify data for accurate analysis
Perform exploratory analysis, build and maintain data processing pipelines from multiple sources using SQL and Python
Build automated dashboards and improve reporting logic to help senior leadership make better decisions







What this job requires:




4+ years of relevant work experience in Analytics, Data Science, Business Intelligence or comparable fields
Profound experience with programming languages such as Python, SQL and Shell Script
Strong knowledge of SQL and NoSQL databases (e.g., MySQL, PostgreSQL, JSON, MongoDB)
Familiarity with ELK Stack (Elasticsearch, Logstash, Kibana)
Experience with Git and Docker




Don't meet every requirement? We strongly encourage you to apply if you’re interested. We want to get to know you.

Please note, that we can accept only PDF as attachments to the application. Other formats will not be screened. Thank you for your understanding.




What Zertificon offers you




Flexible working hours and home office possible
Mobility: free Germany ticket, job bike leasing or car parking
Allowances for food (e.g. Lieferando) and internet in the home office
Benefits in the office: Roof terraces & green courtyard, organic fruit and drinks, parcel acceptance
Get-together: pizza Friday in the office, regular team events, big summer party
Responsible leadership: onboarding, regular feedback meetings and transparent quarterly targets
Innovative without start-up risk: We are independent of investors and our business model has been profitable since 2004 – but we are not resting on our laurels and continue to pursue big plans
Meaningful work in IT security and the opportunity to work on the major challenges of our time
Great market potential worldwide




Want to know more? Please have a look at our Work at Zertificon page: https://www.zertificon.com/en/it-jobs-berlin/work-at-zertificon







Questions?

You can reach our HR team at

+49 30 5900 300-44

jobs@zertificon.com

With 20 years of expertise in cryptography, Zertificon is a recognized name in IT security. Title: Senior Data Analyst (m/f/d)
Description:
We at Friendsurance

We believe that dealing with insurance should bring a smile to your face. We build the most intuitive B2B2C SaaS platform, making insurance all about the customer.

As a deeply engaged and capable Senior Data Analyst (m/f/d), you thrive on shaping a strong data culture and building insights-driven solutions that empower those around you.

You act as a key interface between business and data, translating complex information into clear, impactful decisions. In this role, you’ll engage in cross-functional collaboration, reporting, and the development of data products while contributing to strategic company initiatives.

Your Tasks & Responsibilities


Shape and define the information goals of the business and stakeholders.
Deliver the right reports, analyses, and data solutions using the most suitable tools and technologies for each task.
Identify and integrate useful data sources, collaborating with Data Engineers and stakeholders to build sustainable, end-to-end analytics solutions.
Co-own and evolve data models and business data structures to ensure consistency, scalability, and alignment with business needs.
Lead and support legacy data migrations, ensuring data integrity, efficiency, and seamless integration into modern systems.
Optimize and improve the analytics tech stack, continuously enhancing data processes and tooling.
Work closely with stakeholders to refine requirements and improve how data-driven priorities are set.
Shape the company's Data Strategy alongside the data team and company leadership.
Champion and contribute to a strong data culture across the organization.
Provide expert guidance and support, helping stakeholders obtain the insights they need to make decisions and track success.


How You Will Contribute


Providing reliable and coherent business data to stakeholders in management and large B2B partners
Creating continuously improving self-service analytics solutions
Building up our data-models and domain-understanding across all company functions
Shape and deliver strategic projects around Data that create direct value


By the way - You don’t need to check all the boxes. We want to meet YOU!

Your profile


5+ years of experience in business intelligence and data analytics, delivering insights and reports that drive decision-making.
Proven track record of building insightful reports and conducting in-depth analysis using established reporting tools, preferably Tableau.
Strong SQL expertise with relational databases, especially PostgreSQL, as well as ANSI SQL/Snowflake. Bonus points for query optimization, big-data querying, and columnar storage experience.
Ability to architect and structure reporting and analytics frameworks in a systematic, reusable, and scalable way.
Excellent communication skills, enabling you to effectively convey insights to stakeholders and collaborate with technical and non-technical team members.
Experience with and affinity for Domain-Driven Design (DDD), and other data modeling fundamentals.
Self-sufficient in adopting new technologies and integrating diverse data sources, continuously expanding your analytics capabilities.
Knowledge of common third-party data sources and analytical tools, such as Google Analytics.
Bonus points for experience in adjacent fields like Data Science and Data Engineering (especially Python but also MATLAB, R, Machine Learning, MapReduce, etc.).
A highly professional, curious, proactive, and supportive mindset, driving collaboration and innovation.
Experience working successfully with colleagues from diverse cultural backgrounds.
Fluent in English (C1 or higher) is a must; German is a plus.


We as a Team

We are a tight-knit group in a founder-owned “grown-up” startup. We love what we do and what we build and we care about our amazing team. We value each team member and develop their unique talents.

At Friendsurance, we believe that today's social structures disproportionately disadvantage people from marginalized populations - including people of color, people with disabilities, working-class people, single parents, women, and members of LGBTQIA+ communities. We also believe that these groups need to be actively included in the workforce. Therefore, we strongly encourage people with these identities or members of other marginalized communities to apply. We do not require a photo or information about your gender/sex or marital status for our application process.

Our offer


100% Remote in Germany, on-site in Berlin, or a mix as you wish
Flexible and family-friendly working hours
A big and lovely designed office in Berlin-Kreuzberg with quiet working conditions, plenty of meeting rooms, and your typical startup amenities
A generous personal development budget for all employees
Legendary team events and parties
Language classes
Urban Sports membership subsidy
Unlimited mental health support through OpenUp
A unique and international team
A people-focused management
And much more!


Sounds interesting? We are very much looking forward to your application <3

About Us

Friendsurance is a Berlin-based Insurtech company, providing easy-to-use innovative insurance solutions for B2C clients and B2B partners.

With partners like Deutsche Bank and Allianz, Friendsurance ist the N°1 bancassurance platform provider in Europe. We work with 7 bancassurance partners, connecting 175 insurers and 50 million addressable users.

Ready to join us?
Show more

Title: Staff Data Analyst
Description:
About GetYourGuide

GetYourGuide is the globally leading marketplace for unforgettable travel experiences. Travelers use GetYourGuide to discover the best things to do in a destination. Since its founding in 2009, travelers from over 170 countries have booked more than 150 million tours, activities, and attraction tickets through GetYourGuide. Powered by a global team of over 700 travel experts and technologists, we are headquartered in Berlin and have 17 local offices around the world. Visit our careers website to learn more.

Team mission

The Analytics team's mission is to enable the organisation to take action based on data. We work on a variety of problems and datasets as members of cross-functional mission teams. We take ownership of the entire analytics funnel, from exploration through recommendations to impact measurement, and take pride in the insights we generate.

You Will


Develop quantitative analysis to initiate and drive business decisions focusing on supply strategy
Help the supply business and tech teams learn about their features by designing and analyzing Experiments.
Design and implement metrics, dashboards, and reports to guide the teams’ strategy and success.
Support the technical teams in tracking and producing more insightful data.
Contribute to the learning and experimentation culture of the company by promoting hypothesis-driven product and operational development and evaluation.


Who You Are


8+ years of relevant experience interpreting data in an analytics, data science or business intelligence role
Ability to collaborate with multiple teams to drive strategic decisions and execute on them
Strong project management skills
Strong knowledge of SQL and knowledge of Python
Experience with data visualization and reporting tools (e.g. Looker, Jupyter Notebooks)
Curiosity and reasoning skills with proven evidence of problem-solving.
Ability to understand user behavior and meaning behind the numbers
Desire to work in an international environment, with minimal direction and with highly engaged individuals
Excellent written and verbal communication skills in English


Nice To Have


Previous experience working with agile product teams is a plus.
Experienced with the statistics and assumptions of experimentation.
Familiarity with ETL technologies like Airflow is a plus.
Experience with big data tools (e.g. Spark, Hive) is a plus


How We Set You Up For Success


Meaningful work that helps create memorable travel experiences
A diverse, inclusive environment where your voice is valued
Collaboration with smart, engaged colleagues from over 80 nationalities
English-speaking office environment
Continuous learning opportunities through monthly Hackathons, weekly tech talks, and an annual external training budget
Mentorship programs to support your growth and career development
Flexible working arrangements to support work-life balance
Well-stocked kitchen and team-building events like our famous pizza & beer Fridays
GetYourGuide vouchers and free German lessons
Relocation assistance if needed


And more...

We look forward to hearing from you

Unlock your full potential and join our mission to create unforgettable experiences for millions around the world. If you have the skills and passion for joining our team, we invite you to apply by submitting your CV/resume in English through the form below. Check out how we hire for tips and visibility into our process and check out life at GetYourGuide. If you have any further questions, please do not hesitate to contact us via jobs@getyourguide.com.

We are an equal opportunity employer

Our commitment is that every qualified person will be evaluated according to skills regardless of age, gender identity, ethnicity, sexual orientation, disability status, or religion. Please refrain from including your picture and age with the application.


Show more

Title: Data Analyst (m/w/d) für das Datentransparenzverfahren
Description:
Sind Sie bereit für Neues und wollen im deutschen Gesundheitswesen mitwirken? Dann unterstützen Sie uns als

Data Analyst (m/w/d) für das Datentransparenzverfahren

Wir, der GKV-Spitzenverband, vertreten die Kranken- und Pflegekassen und damit auch die Interessen der rund 75 Millionen Versicherten und Beitragszahlenden auf Bundesebene gegenüber der Politik und den Leistungserbringenden wie der Ärzte- und Apothekerschaft oder den Krankenhäusern. Als GKV-Spitzenverband übernehmen wir alle nicht-wettbewerblichen Aufgaben in der Kranken- und Pflegeversicherung auf Bundesebene.

Der Stabsbereich Vertragsanalyse unterstützt die Fachabteilungen des GKV Spitzenverbandes mit Datenanalysen. Daneben übernimmt er weitere gesetzliche Aufgaben, wie die Sammlung von Abrechnungsdaten der gesetzlichen Krankenkassen für das Datentransparenzverfahren.

Unsere Benefits Für Sie

Sie erwartet ab sofort ein unbefristetes Arbeitsverhältnis in Vollzeit (39 Stunden wöchentlich). Ihr Arbeitsplatz befindet sich in der Mitte Berlins mit hervorragender Anbindung an den öffentlichen Personennahverkehr in einem modern aufgestellten und tarifgebundenen Verband. Wir bieten


flexible Arbeitszeiten und die Möglichkeit des anteiligen mobilen Arbeitens,
eine sehr attraktive Vergütung nach unserem Haustarifvertrag mit 13 Monatsgehältern,
30 Urlaubstage im Kalenderjahr,
eine betriebliche Altersversorgung und die Möglichkeit eines Zeitwertkontos,
einen Zuschuss zu einem Abonnement im öffentlichen Personennahverkehr,
Teilnahme an individuellen Fort- und Weiterbildungsmöglichkeiten sowie
weitere Vorteile, etwa im Rahmen der betrieblichen Gesundheitsförderung.


Sollten Sie Interesse an einer Teilzeittätigkeit haben, sprechen Sie uns gerne darauf an. Der GKV-Spitzenverband bietet flexible Möglichkeiten, die dazu beitragen, Beruf und Privatleben in Einklang zu bringen.

Bewerbungen von schwerbehinderten und gleichgestellten Menschen sind in besonderer Weise willkommen.

Ihr Zukünftiger Aufgabenbereich


Zukünftig sollen Gesundheitsdaten für die Forschung besser verfügbar sein. Die Nutzung ist klar definiert und am Allgemeinwohl ausgerichtet. Das Ziel ist, die Versorgung der Bevölkerung zu verbessern. Sie wirken dabei mit, die hierfür eingerichtete Datensammelstelle beim GKV Spitzenverband nach
303b SGB V weiterzuentwickeln.
Sie analysieren Daten zu Fragen der gesundheitlichen Versorgung und bereiten die Ergebnisse in geeigneter Form adressatengerecht auf.
Sie entwickeln selbstständig Auswertungsroutinen, um die Daten zu plausibilisieren und auf Vollständigkeit zu prüfen.
Sie unterstützen und beraten interdisziplinär die Fachabteilungen des GKV-Spitzenverbandes bei methodischen und datenrelevanten Fragestellungen.
Sie wirken bei dem Aufbau und der Weiterentwicklung von Analyse-, Monitoring- und Berichtsroutinen mit.
Sie stimmen sich mit unseren Mitgliedskassen, Verbänden und Dienstleistern ab. Außerdem unterstützen und beraten Sie diese zu Fragen der Datenanalyse.


Was wir von Ihnen erwarten?


Sie verfügen über ein erfolgreich abgeschlossenes Hochschulstudium, vorzugsweise im Bereich Gesundheits- oder Sozialwissenschaften, Statistik, Ökonomie beziehungsweise über vergleichbare Qualifikationen.
Sie verfügen über fortgeschrittene Erfahrungen mit einer gängigen Statistiksoftware wie SAS oder fortgeschrittene Kenntnisse in R oder Python.
Sie besitzen sehr gute Kenntnisse in der Arbeit mit Datenbanken einschließlich SQL und können Erfahrungen im Umgang mit großen Datenmengen vorweisen.
Kenntnisse im deutschen Gesundheitswesen, insbesondere in den Datenverfahren und Vergütungssystemen in der gesetzlichen Krankenversicherung, sind von Vorteil.
Ein sehr gutes Kommunikationsvermögen in Wort und Schrift in Deutsch mit mindestens Niveau C2, ausgezeichnete analytische und konzeptionelle Fähigkeiten, Eigeninitiative und Zuverlässigkeit runden Ihr Profil ab.


Wenn wir Ihre Neugier geweckt haben,

bitten wir Sie, Ihre vollständige Bewerbung als PDF-Datei mit maximal 5 MB (Anschreiben, Werdegang, Abschluss- und Arbeitszeugnisse, gegebenenfalls Nachweis über eine Schwerbehinderung) unter Angabe der Ausschreibungsnummer 1145 bis zum 19.03.2025 bei uns einzureichen. Bitte nutzen Sie vorzugsweise das Online-Bewerbungsformular auf unserer Homepage: www.gkv-spitzenverband.de.

Ihre Ansprechperson

Nachfragen richten Sie bitte an Herrn Thomas Staffeldt (Stabsbereichsleiter Vertragsanalyse), Telefonnummer 030 206288-2010.

Bitte beachten Sie, dass beim Versenden der Bewerbungsunterlagen per E-Mail der Inhalt dieser unverschlüsselt ist. Informieren Sie sich über unsere Datenschutzregelungen auf unserer Homepage.

Wir weisen darauf hin, dass unvollständige Bewerbungsunterlagen nicht berücksichtigt werden können.
Show more

Bewerbungen von schwerbehinderten und gleichgestellten Menschen sind in besonderer Weise willkommen.

Ihr Zukünftiger Aufgabenbereich

  • Zukünftig sollen Gesundheitsdaten für die Forschung besser verfügbar sein. Die Nutzung ist klar definiert und am Allgemeinwohl ausgerichtet. Das Ziel ist, die Versorgung der Bevölkerung zu verbessern. Sie wirken dabei mit, die hierfür eingerichtete Datensammelstelle beim GKV Spitzenverband nach
  • 303b SGB V weiterzuentwickeln.
  • Sie analysieren Daten zu Fragen der gesundheitlichen Versorgung und bereiten die Ergebnisse in geeigneter Form adressatengerecht auf.
  • Sie entwickeln selbstständig Auswertungsroutinen, um die Daten zu plausibilisieren und auf Vollständigkeit zu prüfen.
  • Sie unterstützen und beraten interdisziplinär die Fachabteilungen des GKV-Spitzenverbandes bei methodischen und datenrelevanten Fragestellungen.
  • Sie wirken bei dem Aufbau und der Weiterentwicklung von Analyse-, Monitoring- und Berichtsroutinen mit.
  • Sie stimmen sich mit unseren Mitgliedskassen, Verbänden und Dienstleistern ab. Außerdem unterstützen und beraten Sie diese zu Fragen der Datenanalyse.

Was wir von Ihnen erwarten?

  • Sie verfügen über ein erfolgreich abgeschlossenes Hochschulstudium, vorzugsweise im Bereich Gesundheits- oder Sozialwissenschaften, Statistik, Ökonomie beziehungsweise über vergleichbare Qualifikationen.
  • Sie verfügen über fortgeschrittene Erfahrungen mit einer gängigen Statistiksoftware wie SAS oder fortgeschrittene Kenntnisse in R oder Python.
  • Sie besitzen sehr gute Kenntnisse in der Arbeit mit Datenbanken einschließlich SQL und können Erfahrungen im Umgang mit großen Datenmengen vorweisen.
  • Kenntnisse im deutschen Gesundheitswesen, insbesondere in den Datenverfahren und Vergütungssystemen in der gesetzlichen Krankenversicherung, sind von Vorteil.
  • Ein sehr gutes Kommunikationsvermögen in Wort und Schrift in Deutsch mit mindestens Niveau C2, ausgezeichnete analytische und konzeptionelle Fähigkeiten, Eigeninitiative und Zuverlässigkeit runden Ihr Profil ab.

Wenn wir Ihre Neugier geweckt haben,

bitten wir Sie, Ihre vollständige Bewerbung als PDF-Datei mit maximal 5 MB (Anschreiben, Werdegang, Abschluss- und Arbeitszeugnisse, gegebenenfalls Nachweis über eine Schwerbehinderung) unter Angabe der Ausschreibungsnummer 1145 bis zum 19.03.2025 bei uns einzureichen. Bitte nutzen Sie vorzugsweise das Online-Bewerbungsformular auf unserer Homepage: www.gkv-spitzenverband.de.

Ihre Ansprechperson

Nachfragen richten Sie bitte an Herrn Thomas Staffeldt (Stabsbereichsleiter Vertragsanalyse), Telefonnummer 030 206288-2010.

Bitte beachten Sie, dass beim Versenden der Bewerbungsunterlagen per E-Mail der Inhalt dieser unverschlüsselt ist. Informieren Sie sich über unsere Datenschutzregelungen auf unserer Homepage.

Wir weisen darauf hin, dass unvollständige Bewerbungsunterlagen nicht berücksichtigt werden können.

Title: Data Analyst (w/m/d)
Description:
We are Billie, the leading provider of Buy Now, Pay Later (BNPL) payment methods for businesses, offering B2B companies innovative digital payment services and modern checkout solutions. We are to create a new standard for business payments and have made it our mission to simplify the purchasing experience for all businesses making it a tool for growth. Our solutions are based on proprietary, machine-learning-supported risk models, fully digitized processes and a highly scalable tech platform. This makes us a deep-tech company building financial products, not the other way around. We love building simple and elegant solutions and we strive for automation and scalability.

About The Role

Billie’s Analytics team is at the heart of the company supporting multiple functions to make data-driven decisions. Analytics team works closely with all Product segments, and other departments by innovating, hypothesizing, strategizing and providing recommended actions to relevant stakeholders (Decision science, Business Development and Account Management, Collection and Underwriting teams, Customer support and Marketing) in an integrated, scalable, secure and compliant way to enable the company's sustainable growth.

In this role, you will have the chance to make a significant impact by leveraging data and analytics tools, will look for solutions, establish relationships to be able to guide business decisions within the company values and expectations, and contribute to the ongoing growth of our portfolio.

The role is for someone who is a self-starter, enjoys exploring data for insights to support strategic decision making, is passionate about building data structures, analyzing and reporting on key performance indicators, comfortable to work on operational matters, willing to develop expertise in fraud and credit risk prevention, has excellent communication and strong interpersonal skills, is able to document effectively.

This is a unique opportunity for analysts who are eager to immerse themselves in the heart of fintech business, develop additional muscles, and grow within a fast-paced and dynamic environment. You will collaborate with cross-functional teams, apply creative problem-solving skills, and drive business growth through data-driven strategies.

Responsibilities


Perform analysis to develop a deep understanding of the product, and its usage, business processes, and to support business and research hypotheses, including A/B testing of product ideas, identifying new product and business opportunities
Support product segments in creating effective tracking and measurement plans to ensure the impact of new features align with our product strategy
Design data models as part of data solution to support reporting and analysis needs
Create, maintain and update dashboards and reports using BI tools to communicate insights effectively
Enhance data processes, identify gaps, and streamline data collection
Collect, consolidate, and closely track KPI metrics regarding Billie’s portfolio
Perform comprehensive data analysis and EDA to support Risk and Fraud systems optimization
Communicate and present recommendations and key insights to stakeholders and executives to drive business decisions and create an impact
Communicate issues in an independent and timely manner with appropriate internal and external partners


Who We Are Looking For


You have 5+ years of proven experience in data analytics, data engineering or quantitative analytics
Proficiency in writing structured and efficient SQL queries for large data sets
Proficiency in data and analytics concepts, tools, and methodologies
Have prior experience building intuitive data visualizations and dashboards that influence business decisions, utilizing tools like Looker, Tableau, Mixpanel, or similar
Proven track record of managing complex initiatives with strong emphasis on data, providing actionable insights and tracking success of those initiatives
Able to communicate complex problems in a simple and relevant manner at all levels
Experience with translating analytical insights into data driven business prioritization
You have strong business acumen coupled with highly analytical mindset
You had the chance to work in a fast-paced and dynamic environment
Strong sense of responsibility, self-starter, well organized, good planner, able to work independently and meet deadlines
Previously experience in a fraud, risk & payment management environment is an advantage


What We Offer


Challenging and impactful work that drives personal and professional growth
One of the best Virtual Shares Incentive Programs in the market, so that everyone at Billie is invested in our success
Flexible work hours and trust in your ability to deliver, empowering you to take control of your work-life balance
A hybrid working approach that allows you to work from home for up to 3 days per week
Enjoy 30 days vacation per year on top of paid public holidays, sabbatical opportunities, and extra child sickness leave for parents
Our “Catch a Ride with Billie” program that enables discounted access to Berlin Public Transport (BVG), Deutschland-Ticket, OR JobRad
A yearly development budget to broaden your skill set and horizons
Free German group classes
An English-speaking, multicultural team with more than 40 nationalities represented
Building meaningful connections with your colleagues through company and team events, interest groups, the Billie run club, game nights, and more, powered by our Formula Fun Team!
Great office space at Checkpoint Charlie with free gym access, barista coffee, drinks and more


Billie offers you the opportunity to be a part of one of the fastest-growing Fintech startups in Europe following the mission to innovate to create new freedom for businesses of all sizes. Our combined decades of experience in B2B Financing and Payments in a market thirsty for innovation and change make this a fantastic possibility to get into the most dynamic space in tech.

Join an international team of talented, passionate people where drive and merit matter. We work in nimble, cross-functional teams with open communication lines across the company. You’ll be surrounded by smart people from a wide variety of backgrounds from which you can learn and that want to learn from you.

Are you ready to join Billie?

Billie is proud to be an equal-opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment in our workplace. By embracing talents and abilities of all kinds, we aim to boost motivation and team creativity. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, national origin, age, marital status, gender, political views, beliefs, sexual orientation, color, disability status, or any other demographic factors.

Please Note

Our policy includes a 180-day waiting period before reconsidering candidates for the same role. This ensures a fair and thorough evaluation of all applicants. If you apply within this cool-off period, your application will be automatically rejected.

Thank you for your understanding.

Title: Data Analyst (m/w/d) Pricing
Description:
DocMorris steht für kundenorientierte innovative Dienstleistungen und eine große Produktvielfalt rund um die digitale Gesundheitsversorgung. Sie reichen von der schnellen Terminvereinbarung für den Online-Arztbesuch auf der Telemedizin-Plattform von TeleClinic bis zur pharmazeutischen Beratung und Versorgung mit verschreibungspflichtigen und rezeptfreien Medikamenten sowie Gesundheitsprodukten aus Deutschlands bekanntester Online-Apotheke.
Hinzu kommt der Marktplatz mit einem breiten ergänzenden Sortiment von Heil- und Hilfsmitteln sowie Produkten aus den Bereichen Ernährung, Beauty und Familie. Damit schafft DocMorris für ihre Kundinnen und Kunden einen einfachen Zugang zu umfassenden Gesundheitsdienstleistungen an einem Ort mit nur einem Klick. Im Segment Deutschland erwirtschaftete die Schweizer DocMorris AG im Jahr 2023 mit über 9 Millionen aktiven Kundinnen und Kunden einen Außenumsatz von 976 Millionen CHF.


Aufgaben



Du entwickelst Reportings und erstellst Ad-hoc-Analysen zur Umsatz-, Margen- und Preisentwicklung sowie zum Erfolg unserer Promotions.


Auf dieser Basis erarbeitest Du Handlungsempfehlungen für strategische und taktische Pricing-Entscheidungen. Damit trägst Du maßgeblich zum Geschäftserfolg unserer Produkte im Bereich der freiverkäuflichen Arzneimittel bei.


Du entwickelst unsere Pricing-Prozesse weiter und wirkst mit bei der Optimierung unserer Pricing-Algorithmen. Dabei wendest Du auch komplexe Analysemethoden an.


Du arbeitest eng mit den Bereichen Online-Marketing, Category Management, Supply-Chain-Management und Einkauf sowie unserem Data-Team zusammen.



Qualifikation



Du verfügst über ein abgeschlossenes Hochschulstudium in Mathematik, Statistik, Wirtschaftsinformatik oder Betriebswirtschaftslehre.


Ein kommerzielles Verständnis im Bereich E-Commerce, idealerweise im Bereich Pricing, rundet Dein Profil ab.


Du hast Kenntnisse im Umgang mit relationalen Datenbanken, hast bereits mit SQL gearbeitet und besitzt Erfahrungen mit BI- und Visualisierungstools (z.B. Tableau, Power BI, QlikView oder anderen).


Idealerweise hast Du bereits statistische Analysemethoden angewendet und mit gängigen Statistiksoftwarepaketen gearbeitet.


Du hast ausgeprägte analytische und konzeptionelle Fähigkeiten.


Du sprichst gutes Deutsch und gutes Englisch.



Benefits



Attraktive Vergünstigungen in diversen Shops über Corporate Benefits


Betriebliche Altersvorsorge mit attraktiven Arbeitgeberzuschüssen


30 Urlaubstage


Möglichkeit zur Teilnahme am Mitarbeiterbeteiligungsprogramm (Aktienoptionen)


Zugang zu eLearning-Plattformen wie LinkedIn Learning


Fairer Lohn für Festangestellte und Zeitarbeitnehmer sowie angemessene Vergütung von Praktika


Weiterbildungsmöglichkeiten und regelmäßige Entwicklungsgespräche


Tolle Mitarbeiter-Events und jährliche Firmenfeiern


Wohlfühl-Arbeitsumgebung mit klimatisierten, hellen Büros. Ergonomisch eingerichtete Arbeitsplätze mit hochmoderner technischer Ausstattung.


Flexible Arbeitszeitmodelle und Homeoffice-Möglichkeiten


Gute Anbindung an den öffentlichen Nahverkehr





Gestalte mit uns das neue Gesund! Wir freuen uns auf Deine aussagekräftige Bewerbung!




Bei Fragen steht Dir Matthias Wegerle unter der Telefonnummer +49 (0)621 397316 654 gerne zur Verfügung.

Title: AI Data Analyst (m/w/d) – Daten, Automatisierung & KI-Innovation
Description:
Das Unternehmen




Unser Kunde, ein dynamisches, profitables Unternehmen im E-Commerce sucht aktuell einen AI Analyst (m/w/d), der datengetriebene Prozesse optimiert und Automatisierungslösungen entwickelt.

Das Unternehmen hat sich als führende Plattform in seiner Nische etabliert und verbindet Technologie mit kreativen Produkten. Mit einem starken digitalen Fokus setzt es auf innovative Datenstrategien, um personalisierte Erlebnisse für seine Kunden zu schaffen. Hier bekommst du die Möglichkeit, modernste KI-Technologien in einem datengetriebenen Umfeld einzusetzen und direkt Einfluss auf das Wachstum des Unternehmens zu nehmen.




Deine Rolle

Du bist ein analytischer Kopf mit einem Gespür für datenbasierte Optimierung? In dieser Position übernimmst du die Verantwortung für die Analyse, Integration und Automatisierung von Datenprozessen, um strategische Entscheidungen zu unterstützen und operative Abläufe effizienter zu gestalten.

Deine Hauptaufgaben umfassen:

Effiziente Datenverarbeitung & Automatisierung – Entwicklung von datengetriebenen Workflows zur Optimierung unternehmensweiter Prozesse
KI-gestützte Optimierung: Einsatz moderner Technologien wie Machine Learning zur Automatisierung von Geschäftsprozessen
Analyse & Reporting – Erstellung von Dashboards und Berichten zur Visualisierung von Trends und Geschäftskennzahlen
Datenverknüpfung & -modellierung – Strukturierung und Integration heterogener Datenquellen für eine konsistente und belastbare Datenbasis
Technologieeinsatz & Innovation – Identifikation neuer Tools und Methoden zur Automatisierung von Analyse- und Reportingprozessen
Zusammenarbeit mit internen Teams – Unterstützung von Fachbereichen wie Marketing, Produktentwicklung und IT durch datenbasierte Erkenntnisse




Dein Profil

Abgeschlossenes Studium mit analytischem oder technischem Schwerpunkt (z. B. Data Science, Wirtschaftsinformatik, BWL mit Fokus auf Analytics)
Mind. 1 Jahr berufliche Erfahrung im eCommerce
Erfahrung in der Verarbeitung und Analyse großer Datenmengen aus unterschiedlichen Quellen
Sehr gute Kenntnisse in SQL sowie praktische Erfahrung mit Data Warehousing
Grundlegende Programmierkenntnisse (z. B. Python) zur Automatisierung von Abläufen von Vorteil
Strukturierte, analytische Denkweise mit der Fähigkeit, Daten in umsetzbare Maßnahmen zu übersetzen
Interesse an datengetriebenen Geschäftsmodellen und digitalen Märkten
Erfahrung mit Performance-Marketing, Web-Analytics ist ein Plus, aber kein Muss




Was dich erwartet

Verantwortung & Gestaltungsspielraum – Du hast direkten Einfluss auf datengetriebene Entscheidungen und kannst eigene Ideen einbringen
Hybrides Arbeitsmodell – Flexibilität zwischen Homeoffice und Büro, angepasst an deine Bedürfnisse
Weiterbildungsmöglichkeiten – Individuelle Entwicklung durch Schulungen, Workshops und regelmäßiges Feedback
Attraktive Zusatzleistungen – Vergünstigungen für Sportangebote, Mobilitätslösungen und exklusive Mitarbeiterrabatte
Dynamische Unternehmenskultur – Ein motiviertes Team, das sich gegenseitig inspiriert und gemeinsam Erfolge feiert




Bereit, Daten in wertvolle Insights zu verwandeln? Dann freuen wir uns auf deine Bewerbung!

Show more

  • Attraktive Zusatzleistungen – Vergünstigungen für Sportangebote, Mobilitätslösungen und exklusive Mitarbeiterrabatte
  • Dynamische Unternehmenskultur – Ein motiviertes Team, das sich gegenseitig inspiriert und gemeinsam Erfolge feiert


Bereit, Daten in wertvolle Insights zu verwandeln? Dann freuen wir uns auf deine Bewerbung!

Title: Data Analyst (0 Experience Required)
Description:
For thousands of years, maps have provided humans with the knowledge they need to make decisions. As a Maps Evaluator, you will have the opportunity to provide ground truth for your town, city or country.




At Peroptyx, we are looking for Data Analysts who will review mapping data for digital mapping applications. Your research capabilities will validate and ensure that the navigation of certain routes are accurate and safe.




As part of this role you will verify that business names and opening hours are correct. You will check that the distance from a starting point to an end destination is listed accurately resulting in better user experiences.




With this job you can plan your days around this highly flexible working schedule, work weekends or late evenings, all from the comfort of your own office. The flexibility of our roles minimizes the impact on your daily routine.




So, whether you are a student looking to earn as you learn, a retiree looking for a new challenge a part-time/full time professional or a work from home parent, Peroptyx has the right role for you!




Benefits

Work up to 20 hours per week.
Earn a competitive rate of pay.
Develop your research skills.
Avoid the long commute.
Work from the comfort of your home office.
Enjoy the flexibility of setting your own working hours!




Ideal Candidate

Fluent in English and German.
Excellent research skills.
Excellent local knowledge of your home country.
Good understanding and general knowledge of the geography and culture of Germany.
Analytical mindset.




Job Requirements

Must be living in Germany for a minimum of 5 consecutive years.
Must pass an online open-book exam that can verify your full understanding of the material and concepts.
Must be willing to work a minimum of 10 hours and up to 20 hours per week depending on task availability.
Good working knowledge of search engines, map applications and familiarity with social media platforms.
Strong ability to learn, understand and apply multiple sets of different instructions.
All work must be of an independent nature.







Apply Online Today!

Show more

Title: Senior Data Analyst (f/m/x)
Description:
EMBRACE THE WORLD: HOP ON YOUR NEXT ADVENTURE WITH US!

We are a lively and diverse team, founded by our CEO Julian Weselek in 2016, currently active in the DACH region and France. Our ambition is to become the leading travel company for authentic, customized, multi-day trips while being mindful of our planet: we are the first travel company in the EU to set near-term carbon reduction targets approved by the Science Based Targets initiative (SBTi): this is an imperative step toward decarbonization. We are and always will be driving the change in the travel industry for a better tomorrow.

DESTINATION? THE WORLD!

We are discoverers. We are believers in the life-changing power of travel. On our journey we've built the amazing team that we have today - a team that sets the ambition to be remembered for building the future of travel, for consistently changing the norms of the industry and, simply, for staying true to our passion for bringing together the cultures of the world.

What is the role about?


Ultimately, we work to create the best experience in travel, using data to improve our customer experience and our product, increase our marketing reach, and optimize our costs
Own data projects fully end to end. You will manage data pipelines, ensure data quality, model data in dbt, and put them into reports or visualizations in Looker
Bring ideas to life. We welcome prototyping solutions that generate impact right away
Work as one team with Data Engineers, Data Scientists, Data Analysts, and business users to maintain and improve our data infrastructure
The Tools We Use:
Warehousing and ELT: Snowflake, dbt, SQL
Visualisation: Looker (LookML)
Data Sources and Importing Tools: Salesforce, Internal Applications, Event Data, Fivetran and Airbyte
Ad-Hoc Analysis: SQL, R, Python



What will you need to be successful?


You are proficient in SQL and bring previous experience in data analytics, data science, business intelligence, or a related field. We welcome applicants with an academic background
You have knowledge of statistics - using statistical concepts in testing, modeling, and forecasting
You have a strong business mindset and you are able to communicate data topics to non-technical stakeholders
You are able to work independently and have a problem-solving mindset
You like to collaborate with your colleagues. You ask colleagues when you’re stuck and help them out when they are. You discuss ideas and challenges



YOU ARE THE WORLD


We value your participation in Tourlane's success and complement your cash compensation with a package of employee stock options (ESOP)
Flexible working setup to get the most of your working hours: we offer full flexibility in our Hybrid/Remote model, however we do expect that you take advantage of our lively Berlin office 2-3 days per week
We share your passion for traveling: enjoy working abroad through our new program
Your wellbeing matters to us: we offer mindfulness classes to take care of your mental health, sessions with Nilo.health
We support all the diverse communities that make us Tourlane: join or create your own Employee Resource Group (ERG) and connect with Tourlaneans
Dog-friendly office: we can’t wait to meet your furry friend!



Sounds interesting? We are excited to get to know you!

Data privacy policy.
Show more

Title: BI-Consultant (m/w/d) - Remote oder Berlin
Description:
Business Intelligence, Corporate Performance und Data Management sowie Controlling und Finanzen: Bei diesen sehr daten- und zahlen­getriebenen Herausforderungen unterstützen wir bei der xax mit einem über 70-köpfigen Team an 5 Standorten deutschlandweit Unternehmen mit der Digitalisierung ihrer individuellen Reporting-, Analyse- und Planungs­prozesse. Von der passenden Tool-Auswahl und der Anforderungsaufnahme über die erfolgreiche Implementierung ihrer individuellen Lösung auf Basis professioneller Software-Werkzeuge bis hin zu Schulungen, Coachings und laufendem Projekt-Support erhalten unsere Kunden seit über 20 Jahren bei uns alles aus einer Hand.




Zur Verstärkung unseres Berliner Teams suchen wir zum nächstmöglichen Zeitpunkt einen BI-Consultant - gern auch zu 100% remote, in Voll- oder Teilzeit.




Was wir Dir bieten:




Spannende, anspruchsvolle und abwechslungsreiche Aufgaben mit viel Gestaltungsfreiraum und Entwicklungsmöglichkeiten, wie bspw.:

Eigenständige Gestaltung von kundenspezifischen BI-Lösungen (Reporting, Planung) unter Einsatz unterschiedlicher BI-Software (u.a. Infor, Board, Jedox, MS Power BI).
Erstellung individueller ETL-Prozesse, relationaler Data Warehouse-Architekturen sowie multidimensionaler Datenbanklösungen unter Nutzung leistungsfähiger BI-Werkzeuge (u.a. DataVault Builder, MS SSIS).
Direkte Kundenkommunikation, fachliche und technische Anforderungsaufnahme und Beratung.
Die Möglichkeit, Deine Stärken und Ideen individuell einzubringen und zu verwirklichen, um Dich dadurch weiter zu entwickeln.
Ein Team mit starkem Zusammenhalt, das Dir für Fragen und Unterstützung zur Verfügung steht.
Vom ersten Tag an eine Kommunikation auf Augenhöhe mit jedem Teammitglied.
Schnelle Entscheidungsprozesse mit viel Platz für neue Ideen.
Flexible und angenehme Arbeitsbedingungen, wie z.B. Home-Office / Remote-Möglichkeiten.




Was Du mitbringst:




Ausgeprägte Dienstleistungsorientierung und hohe Zuverlässigkeit.
Du verfügst über eine abgeschlossene IT-nahe Ausbildung (z. B. als Kaufmann/-frau für IT-System-Management) oder ein Studium der (Wirtschafts-)Informatik – alternativ bringst du eine vergleichbare Qualifikation für diese Position mit.
Erste Erfahrung im Customizing gängiger BI-Systeme (wie z.B. MS Power BI, Infor, Qlik, Board, Jedox o.ä.)
Grundlegendes betriebswirtschaftliches Verständnis sowie erste Erfahrungen im Projektmanagement.
Tatendrang, Eigeninitiative sowie Spaß an neuen Herausforderungen.
Die Fähigkeit, im Team als auch Kunden gegenüber offen, zielgerichtet und lösungsorientiert zu kommunizieren.
Den Anspruch, Dein Wissen stets zu erweitern, Neues zu lernen sowie Dich und Deinen Erfolg selbstbestimmt zu organisieren.
Großes Interesse an regelmäßigem Feedback.
Verantwortlicher Umgang mit Vertrauensarbeitszeit.
Authentisches Auftreten sowie viele Ecken und Kanten.
Ein sehr gutes Ausdrucksvermögen in der deutschen Sprache.




Interesse?




Wir freuen uns über Deine Bewerbung (im PDF-Format) unter Angabe Deines frühesten Eintrittstermins.

Show more

Title: Senior Data Analyst (m/f/d)
Description:
About

At Riverty, we believe that everyone should be in control of their own financial situation. Our shared commitment is to make financial solutions more innovative, empathetic and user-friendly to empower financial growth for everyone. To do this, we rely on 50 years of experience and the commitment of over 5,000 creative minds, innovators and explorers in 11 countries.

Are you ready?

As part of our community, you will have the opportunity to develop your skills and transform the world of finance together with us. We create an environment where you can evolve personally and benefit from our flexible working conditions and work-life balance.

Everything we do, starts with you. Together with you, we build the most human-centric fintech. To enable everyone’s future financial growth.

We are looking for a

Senior Data Analyst (m/f/d)

(unlimited, full-time) Join our team at our location in Berlin, Verl, Baden-Baden, Oslo or Stockholm – flexible working conditions available

Key Responsibilities

Explore large datasets, evaluate the data quality and model data

Apply statistical methods to understand consumer behavioral patterns relevant for product development and operational efficiency

Analyze problems to understand their root cause

Work with Data Scientists and Data Engineers to build and implement analytical solutions

Collaborate on data-related projects

Visualize data and turn data into stories

Derive actionable insights, provide decision support, and make recommendations based on data-driven insights

Consult business units and functional units, such as product or commercial teams in data related questions

Drive, manage and lead data related projects while fostering a culture of data-driven decision-making across the organization.

Your Profile

5+ years of hands-on experience in data analysis roles within Data & Analytics solutions

Master/MBA degree in numerate subject (e.g. Data Science, Mathematics, Informatics, Economics, Natural Science or Engineering)

Proficient in a programming language such as SQL, Python or R

Experience in cluster analysis, machine learning

Understanding of how to perform data extraction and manipulation

Advanced in collecting, organizing, analysing, and disseminating significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy

Ability to identify issues, structure and conduct necessary analysis, and draw well-informed conclusions

Consulting skills, especially strong ability to provide insights and recommendations

Extraordinary communication skills to effectively convey complex information and collaborate with diverse teams

Ability to balance multiple priorities, be detail-oriented, work independently, and meet deadlines in a fast-paced environment

Excellent Team player

Nice If You Have

Experience within the payments, risk, debt collection or factoring space

Experience with modern data stacks, preferably Databricks

Experience in quantitative research

Benefits

Mobile Office: Opportunity to work from home

Discounts & Extras: Exclusive Bertelsmann discounts and financial benefits, e.g., €1,500 referral bonus

Flexible Working Hours and Models: Customize your working hours to suit your needs

Training & Development: A variety of (online) courses, from language learning to leadership training, e.g., from Bertelsmann University

Health & Leisure: Supported sports and (mental) health programs, e.g. from our partner TELUS Health

Appreciative Environment: Diversity and employee networks enrich our culture

#EUR33

Equal Opportunity Employer Statement

We want to be a fair and inclusive employer. We value the diverse perspectives that a diverse workforce brings to the table. Therefore, we are actively looking for people who enrich our company through their identity, background and personal experiences, with or without a disability.

Nice-to-have skills


SQL
Python
R
Machine Learning
Berlin, Berlin, Germany


Work experience


Data Analyst
Data Scientist
IT Consultant


Languages


English
Show more

Title: (Senior) Data Analyst - Marketing (d/f/m)
Description:
Personio's intelligent HR platform helps small and medium-sized organizations unlock the power of people by making complicated, time-consuming tasks simple and efficient. Our growing team of 1,800+ Personios across Europe and the US are building user-friendly products that delight our 14,000+ customers and their 1.5 million employees. Ready to make an impact from day one?

The Role: How you'll make an impact at Personio

This position can be hybrid from one of the following office locations: London, Munich, Dublin, Madrid, or Berlin.

We empower Personio's decision-making with advanced analytics and strategic insights, while boosting productivity through systems improvement and automation. Be part of our transformative journey in HR technology, where your contributions will shape our data-driven future.

In this pivotal role, you'll spearhead our marketing strategies, aligning them seamlessly with sales objectives to propel business success. As a Senior Marketing Data Analyst, you'll be the cornerstone of our Go-to-market department, leveraging your expertise in analysis, trend forecasting, and strategic planning to ignite innovative marketing initiatives and foster robust collaboration with our Sales team.

Role Responsibilities: What you'll do


Strategic Marketing Planning: You'll lead data-driven strategies within our Go-to-market framework, ensuring they resonate with our sales targets and organizational objectives.
Marketing Campaign Analysis: You're responsible for assessing campaign performance, optimizing for maximum ROI across various channels and regions.
Customer Segmentation and Personalization: You will execute advanced segmentation and collaborate with the GTM team for targeted marketing, boosting lead conversion and retention.
Trend Identification and Forecasting: Your role involves analyzing market trends, predicting future shifts, and offering competitive insights.
Team Leadership and Collaboration: You will mentor analysts and ensure cross-departmental cohesion, particularly with Sales and CX teams.
Report Generation and Presentation: You're tasked with creating and presenting reports that drive continuous improvement.
Budget Management: You oversee marketing KPI adjustments within our bi-annual budget review, ensuring alignment with financial and marketing goals.


Role Requirements: What you need to succeed


Experience: 4+ years in marketing analytics, with a leadership background.
Statistical Knowledge: Understanding of basic statistical models for business problem analysis.
Platform Familiarity: Skilled in Google Analytics, HubSpot, Salesforce, Marketo, Dreamdata, and Snowflake.
Data-Driven Leadership: Experience in fostering a data-centric culture and making data-based decisions.
Analytical Mindset: Intellectual curiosity to delve into data, identifying trends, patterns, and actionable insights.
Communication Skills: Ability to simplify complex data insights for diverse stakeholders.
Entrepreneurial Approach: Proactive problem-solving, focusing on impactful results and leveraging data insights for tangible improvements.


Why Personio

Personio is an equal opportunities employer, committed to building an integrative culture where everyone feels welcomed and supported. We embrace uniqueness and understand that our diverse, values-driven culture makes us stronger. We are proud to have an inclusive workplace environment that will foster your development no matter your gender, civil status, family status, sexual orientation, religion, age, disability, education level, or race.

Aside from our people, culture, and mission, check out some of the other benefits that make Personio a great place to work:


Receive a competitive reward package – reevaluated each year – that includes salary, benefits, and pre-IPO equity
Enjoy 28 days of paid vacation, plus an additional day after 2 and 4 years
Make an impact on the environment and society with 1 Impact Day per year
Receive generous family leave, child support, mental health support, and sabbatical opportunities
We follow an office-led, remote-friendly approach, including opportunities to work from home and international locations. Many of our teams have designated days for gathering in the office to enhance collaboration and foster a sense of community.
We enjoy gathering for meals, cultural initiatives, and events like local Summer Sessions and year-end celebrations. There's also healthy snacks, drinks, and a weekly catered lunch.
Show more
